00001 /*
00002 ###############################################################################
00003 #
00004 #  EGSnrc egs++ smart envelope geometry headers
00005 #  Copyright (C) 2015 National Research Council Canada
00006 #
00007 #  This file is part of EGSnrc.
00008 #
00009 #  EGSnrc is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010 #  the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published by the
00011 #  Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your
00012 #  option) any later version.
00013 #
00014 #  EGSnrc is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00015 #  WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
00016 #  FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Affero General Public License for
00017 #  more details.
00018 #
00019 #  You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
00020 #  along with EGSnrc. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00021 #
00022 ###############################################################################
00023 #
00024 #  Author:          Iwan Kawrakow, 2008
00025 #
00026 #  Contributors:    Frederic Tessier
00027 #
00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A "smart" envelope geometry. The smartness is due to the fact that there
00031 #  can be only zero or one inscribed geometry per base geometry region, which
00032 #  makes many of the checks faster.
00033 #
00034 #  In addition, unlike the regular envelope geometry where all inscribed
00035 #  geometries always must completely fit inside the base geometry, here
00036 #  geometries can be inscribed using logic 0 or 1.
00037 #
00038 #  Logic 0 is as before, i.e., geometry must completely fit into the region
00039 #  where it is being inscribed.
00040 #
00041 #  Logic 1 means that the inscribed geometry extends beyond the region and
00042 #  therefore the smart envelope also checks the base geometry in this case.
00043 #  This is very similar to a CD geometry except that now the space outside
00044 #  the inscribed geometry is still part of the geometry.
00045 #
00046 #  Warning: not completely tested, so don't use for production runs yet.
00047 #
00048 ###############################################################################
00049 */
00050 
00051

00137 class EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_EXPORT EGS_SmartEnvelope : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00138 
00139 public:
00140 
00141       EGS_SmartEnvelope(EGS_BaseGeometry *G,
00142             const vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> &fgeoms, const string &Name = "");
00143 
00144       ~EGS_SmartEnvelope();
00145 
00146       bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00147           return g->isInside(x);
00148       };
00149 
00150       int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00151           int ibase = g->isWhere(x);
00152           if( ibase < 0 ) return ibase;
00153           int j = gindex[ibase];
00154           if( j >= 0 ) {
00155               int i = geometries[j]->isWhere(x);
00156               if( i >= 0 ) ibase = local_start[j] + i;
00157           }
00158           return ibase;
00159       };
00160 
00161       int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) { return isWhere(x); };
00162 
00163       bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00164           if( ireg < nbase ) return g->isRealRegion(ireg);
00165           int i = ireg - nbase; int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00166           return geometries[j]->isRealRegion(ireg-local_start[j]);
00167       };
00168 
00169       int medium(int ireg) const {
00170           if( ireg < nbase ) return g->medium(ireg);
00171           int i = ireg - nbase;
00172           int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00173           return geometries[j]->medium(ireg-local_start[j]);
00174       };
00175 
00176       EGS_Float howfarToOutside(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x,
00177                       const EGS_Vector &u) {
00178           if( ireg < 0 ) return 0;
00179           int ibase = ireg < nbase ? ireg : reg_to_base[ireg-nbase];
00180           return g->howfarToOutside(ibase,x,u);
00181       };
00182 
00183       int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00184                  EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
00185           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00186               // inside.
00187               if( ireg < nbase ) {
00188                   // in one of the regions of the base geometry
00189                   // check if we hit a boundary in the base geometry.
00190                   // if we do, newmed and normal get set accordingly.
00191                   int ibase = g->howfar(ireg,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00192                   int j = gindex[ireg];
00193                   if( j >= 0 ) {
00194                       // there is an inscribed geometry in this region
00195                       // => check if we will enter
00196                       int inscr = geometries[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00197                       if( inscr >= 0 )
00198                           // yes, we do.
00199                           return local_start[j] + inscr;
00200                   }
00201                   if( ibase == ireg || ibase < 0 ) return ibase;
00202                   // if here, we enter a new base geometry region.
00203                   j = gindex[ibase];
00204                   if( j >= 0 && itype[j] ) {
00205                       // geometry inscribed in the new base region
00206                       // using inscription type 1 => check if already
00207                       // inside the inscribed
00208                       int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00209                       if( inscr >= 0 ) {
00210                           if( newmed ) *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00211                           return local_start[j] + inscr;
00212                       }
00213                   }
00214                   return ibase;
00215               }
00216               // if here, we are in an inscribed geometry.
00217               int i = ireg-nbase;
00218               int ibase = reg_to_base[i];
00219               int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00220               int ilocal = ireg-local_start[j];
00221               int inew = geometries[j]->howfar(ilocal,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00222               if( itype[j] ) {
00223                   int ibase_new = g->howfar(ibase,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00224                   if( ibase_new != ibase ) {
00225                       if( ibase_new < 0 ) return ibase_new;
00226                       j = gindex[ibase_new];
00227                       if( j >= 0 && itype[j] ) {
00228                           int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00229                           if( inscr >= 0 ) {
00230                               if( newmed ) *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00231                               return local_start[j] + inscr;
00232                           }
00233                       }
00234                       return ibase_new;
00235                   }
00236               }
00237               if( inew < 0 ) {
00238                   if( newmed ) *newmed = g->medium(ibase);
00239                   return ibase;
00240               }
00241               return local_start[j] + inew;
00242           }
00243           // if here, we are outside the base geometry.
00244           // check to see if we will enter.
00245           int ibase = g->howfar(ireg,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00246           if( ibase >= 0 ) {
00247               int j = gindex[ibase];
00248               if( j >= 0 && itype[j] ) {
00249                   int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00250                   if( inscr >= 0 ) {
00251                       if( newmed ) *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00252                       return local_start[j] + inscr;
00253                   }
00254               }
00255           }
00256           return ibase;
00257       };
00258 
00259       EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00260           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00261               EGS_Float tmin;
00262               if( ireg < nbase ) { // in one of the regions of the base geom.
00263                   tmin = g->hownear(ireg,x);
00264                   if( tmin <= 0 ) return tmin;
00265                   int j = gindex[ireg];
00266                   if( j >= 0 ) {
00267                       EGS_Float ti = geometries[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00268                       if( ti < tmin ) tmin = ti;
00269                   }
00270                   return tmin;
00271               }
00272               int i = ireg-nbase;
00273               int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00274               int ilocal = ireg-local_start[j];
00275               tmin = geometries[j]->hownear(ilocal,x);
00276               if( itype[j] ) {
00277                   int ibase = reg_to_base[i];
00278                   EGS_Float tbase = g->hownear(ibase,x);
00279                   if( tbase < tmin ) tmin = tbase;
00280               }
00281               return tmin;
00282           }
00283           return g->hownear(ireg,x);
00284       };
00285 
00286       int getMaxStep() const {
00287           int nstep = g->getMaxStep() + n_in;
00288           for(int j=0; j<n_in; ++j) nstep += geometries[j]->getMaxStep();
00289           return nstep;
00290       };
00291 
00292       bool hasBooleanProperty(int ireg, EGS_BPType prop) const {
00293           if( ireg >= 0 && ireg < nreg ) {
00294               if( ireg < nbase ) return g->hasBooleanProperty(ireg,prop);
00295               int i = ireg-nbase, j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00296               return geometries[j]->hasBooleanProperty(ireg-local_start[j],prop);
00297           }
00298           return false;
00299       };
00300       void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType) {
00301           setPropertyError("setBooleanProperty()");
00302       };
00303       void addBooleanProperty(int) {
00304           setPropertyError("addBooleanProperty()");
00305       };
00306       void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType,int,int,int step=1) {
00307           setPropertyError("setBooleanProperty()");
00308       };
00309       void addBooleanProperty(int,int,int,int step=1) {
00310           setPropertyError("addBooleanProperty()");
00311       };
00312 
00313       const string &getType() const { return type; };
00314 
00315       void printInfo() const;
00316 
00317       void setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00318       void setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00319       EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00320           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return 1;
00321           if( ireg < nbase ) return g->getRelativeRho(ireg);
00322           int i = ireg-nbase; int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00323           return geometries[j]->getRelativeRho(ireg-local_start[j]);
00324       };
00325 
00326       virtual void getLabelRegions (const string &str, vector<int> &regs);

00332       EGS_BaseGeometry **geometries; 
00333       int              *gindex;      
00334       int* reg_to_inscr;        
00335       int* reg_to_base;         
00336       int* local_start;         
00337       char             *itype;
00338       int              n_in;         
00339       int              nbase;   
00340

00349       void setMedia(EGS_Input *,int,const int *);

00353       void setPropertyError(const char *funcname) {
00354           egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope::%s: don't use this method\n  Define "
00355                   "properties in the constituent geometries instead\n",
00356                   funcname);
00357       };
